167972-d-09-07-01-SOO.Narrative: CRV INCIDENT 2359 TOP END JOB WAS SWITCHING 34 TRACK. FOREMAN COUPLED THE TRACK AND HAD HELPER PULLOUT WESTWARD AND SHOVE THE EAST CAR DOWN THE LEAD. FOREMAN SECURED THE CAR, CUT OFF AND HELPER PULLED BACK WEST AND KICKED 8 CARS BACK INTO 34 TRACK. HELPER THOUGHT THE NEXT MOVE WAS TO SHOVE 2 TANKSINTO 35 TRACK SO LINED THE 35 SWITCH FOR 35. FOREMAN WAS DOWN THE LEAD AND DIDN'T NOTICE THAT THE HELPER HAD LINED THE SWITCH FOR 35.  FOREMAN WAS DOWN THE LEAD AND TOLD THE HELPER THAT HE COULD GIVETHE TWO CARS A KICK AND HE WOULD SECURE THEM.  THE HELPER FORGOT TO LINE THE 35 SWITCH FOR THE LEADAND WHEN HE KICKED THE TWO TANKS THEY WENT IN TOWARDS 35 TRACK WITH THE LEADING TANK SIDESWIPING THEWEST CAR ON 34 TRACK WHICH WAS CLEAR OF THE LEAD BUT NOT CLEAR OF 35 TRACK. THE LEAD TANK UTLX 89321 SIDESWIPED THE WEST CAR ON 34 TRACK ATSF 313174.  YARD MANAGER REPORTED TO INCIDENT SITE, INTERVIEWED CREW, PHOTOS WERE TAKEN AND ARRANGED FOR HUMP ENGINE TO PULL CARS EASTWARD ON 34 TRACK.  CREW WAS UHR TESTED.  FORMAL INVESTIGATION WAS SCHEDULED, HOWEVER IT WAS CANCELLED DUE TO SWITCHMAN ACCEPTING RESPONSIBILITY AND SIGNING A WAIVER ACCESSING FIVE DAYS DISCIPLINE RELATING TO JOB PERFORMANCE.NoneNoneNone

168511-d-09-27-01-SOO.Narrative: CP/SOO TRAIN 888 DERAILED EIGHT CARS WHILE ENTERING BRC COMMERICAL YARD TRACK #4 AND CORNERING ONE STANDING CAR, CTRN 603361 ON BRC TRACK #3.    UPON SITE INSPECTION BY CPR ROAD MANAGER AND ES PERSONNEL IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE #4 SWITCH HAS BEEN PREVIOUSLY RUN-THRU BY AN UNDETERMINED/UNKNOWN BRCCREW/TRAIN CAUSING THE POINT TO MOVE AFTER A NUMBER OF CARS ON TRAIN 888 HAD PASSED OVER THE SWITCH.INSPECTION OF THE 4X0 3 SWITCH INDICATED THE SWITCH POINT WAS DAMAGED AND GAPPED APPROXIMATELY ONE-HALF INCH AND THE TIE ROD WAS BENT.   ALSO, WHEEL MARKS WERE FOUND ON THE #3 RAIL FOR APPROXIMATELYTEN FEET SOUTH OF THE SWITCH POINT UNTIL REACHING THE P.O.D. AND FALLING TOWARD THE WEST.    BRC ADVISED THEY INCURRED ESTIMATED $34,000 TO THEIR TRACK.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

168516-d-09-29-01-SOO.Narrative: 260-29 WAS MADE UP ON TRACK A4.  CSX CREW TOOK CHARGE OF THE TRAIN AND WAS INSTRUCTED TO TAKE THE HEAD 20 CARS AND SET THEM TO THE SOUTH LEAD, COME BACK TO THE REMAINING TRAIN ON A4, DOUBLE TO THE 20CARS SO THEY WOULD BE ON THE REAR OF THE TRAIN, THEN SHOVE TRACK A4 TO THE WEST END FOR AN AIR TEST.THE CSX CREW CONTACTED CPR WEST END UMAN TO PROTECT THE SHOVE.  AS THE SHOVE PROGRESSED,  CSX TRAIN 260 RECEIVED A 12 CAR COUNT FROM UMAN.  THIS WAS THE DISTANCE UMAN COULD SEE INTO TRACK A4, BUT HE COULD NOT SEE THE REAR OF THE TRAIN.  CSX TRAIN 260 DID NOT RECEIVE ANOTHER CAR DISTANCE, SO HE SLOWED TO 0.9 MPH.  WHEN  TRAIN 260 RECEIVED ANOTHER 12 CAR COUNT, CSX ENGINEER INCREASED THE THROTTLETO NOTCH 7.  BOTH UNITS WERE IN THE RUN POSITION, AND APPROX. 10 PSI BRAKE APPLICATION WAS USED DURING THE MOVEMENT.  CSX TRAIN 260 TRAVELED WESTWARD APPROX. 1.5 MIN. UNTIL A UDE OCCURRED.  THE  CSXCONDUCTOR WAS ON THE GROUND APPROX. 100 FEET FROM THE DERAILMENT, WATCHING THE SHOVE.  HE WAS MONITORING THE HUMP CHANNEL, 34-34.  CSX ENGINEER AND CPR UMAN WERE ON RADIO CHANNEL 88-88.  THE 1331 STRIP CREW AND CSX TRAIN 260 CONDUCTOR GAVE STOP SIGNS WHEN THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED.  INSPECTION OF THEDERAILMENT SITE SHOWED THE P.O.D. AT THE 4-5 SWITCH FROG.  THE WHEEL LIFTED OVER THE RAIL AND ONTO THE TIES DUE TO EXCESSIVE HEAD END BUFF FORCES.  TRACKS A4, A5, A6, AND 0-00 WERE TAKEN OUT OF SERVICE. I0601-d-09-11-01-PATH.Accident Cause: Interference (other than vandalism) with railroad operations by nonrailroad employee
I0601-d-09-11-01-PATH.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 8:48 AM, PATH POLICE COMMAND WAS NOTIFIED THAT A PLANE STRUCK THE WORLD TRADE CENTER.  AT 8:52 AM TRAIN SERVICE WAS SUSPENDED INTO THE WORLD TRADE CENTER.  ALL PATH EMPLOYEES WERE NOTIFIED BY PHONE TO EVACUATE.  ALL REMAINING EMPLOYEES WERE EVACUATED ON A TRAIN THAT DEPARTED THE STATION AT 9:11 AM.  THE CREW ON THE HOB46 ARRIVING AT WTC WAS INSTRUCTED TO KEEP THE DOORS CLOSED ANDOPERATE THROUGH THE WTC WITHOUT STOPPING.  THESE PASSENGERS WERE RE-ROUTED TO 33RD STREET.  AT 9:02AM THE PATH EMERGENCY OPERATIONS PLAN WAS PUT INTO EFFECT AND REMAINING SERVICE OPERATED ON A 10 MINUTE SCHEDULE. AT 10:45 AM PASSENGER TRAIN OPERATIONS WERE SUSPENDED AS A RESULT OF CONCERNS FOR PUBLIC SAFETY.  BOTH TOWERS FELL CAUSING DEBRIS TO FALL INTO THE STATION AND ON A TRAIN LOCATED ON TRACK3 AT WORLD TRADE CENTER.  CARS IN CONSIST WERE: 612-139-750-731-160-143-745.  FLOODING OCCURRED ANDWATER FLOWED AS FAR AS EXCHANGE PLACE STATION IN JERSEY CITY.  MAINTENANCE PERSONNEL WORKED ROUND THE CLOCK TO PUMP TUNNELS E AND F AND BUILD INTERIM WATER BARRIERS TO PREVENT POTENTIALLY CATASTROPHIC WATER INTRUSION INTO THE REMAINDER OF THE PATH SYSTEM.  SIXTEEN PATH STAFF INCURRED STRESS/ PHYSICAL INJURIES RESULTING FROM THEIR EVACUATION FROM THE NORTH TOWER AND WTC COMPLEX.  AS A RESULT OF THIS INCIDENT THE PRELIMINARY DAMAGE ESTIMATE TO REPLACE 7 CARS, REBUILD THE WTC TERMINAL STATION, GUTAND RESTORE TUNNELS E AND F IS IN EXCESS OF $1 BILLION DOLLARS.  THIS DOES NOT INCLUDE COSTS TO MOD

0103-d-09-24-01-DMIR.Narrative: ENGINEER OFR DWP CREW (TRAIN #346) EXCEEDED MAXIMUM AUTHORIZED SPEED FOR 3.19 MILES AND REACHED A TOP SPEED OF 32 MPH FOR 1.20 MILES WHILE OPERATING SOUTHBOUND ON THE STEELTON HILL.  AT MP R 11.4 THEBRAKE PIPE WAS REDUCED TO FULL SERVICE WITH A DECLINNING SPEED.  AT MP R 11.95.  THE ENGINEER RELEASED THE AIR BRAKES AT 7 MPH WHILE IN THROTTLE #4 WHICH RESULTED IN A BROKEN KNUCKLE SEVEN CARS FROM THE HEAD-END.  IT APPEARS THAT EXTREME BUFF FORCES WERE CREATED AS A RESULT OF THE TRAIN LINE EMERGENCY.  THE NORTH AND SOUTH TRUCK OF GTW 309697 AND LW 74396 RESPECTIVELY FORCED THE RAIL TO SPREAD ANDTHE TRUCKS TO DERAIL.  WHILE THE TRAILING TRUCK OF GTW 309697 DERAILED, THE BRAKE PIPE WAS PINCHEDCLOSED A SUFFICIENT AMOUNT TO ALLOW BRAKE PIPE PRESSURE TO BUILD AND THE HEAD 134 CARS TO PROCEED 0.85 MILES BEFORE THE DWP CREW WAS INFORMED BY RADIO TO STOP THE TRAIN.  #37: FOR YOUR INFORMATION, $37,250 DAMAGE WAS TO BRIDGE 11B.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
